qas.question: How many members did the original Houston city council have?
How many at-large positions were there originally?
What areas do at-large council members represent?
What population figure needs to be passed to add at large council members?
How many at-large council members were added in the 2011 elections?

context: The original city council line-up of <a0_0><b5_0>14<b5_0/><a0_0/> members (nine district-based and <a1_0><b6_0>five<b6_0/><a1_0/> at-large positions) was based on a U.S. Justice Department mandate which took effect in 1979. At-large council members represent the <a2_0><b7_0>entire city<b7_0/><a2_0/>. Under the city charter, once the population in the city limits exceeded <a3_0><b8_0>2.1 million<a3_0/> residents<b8_0/>, two additional districts were to be added. The city of Houston's official 2010 census count was 600 shy of the required number; however, as the city was expected to grow beyond 2.1 million shortly thereafter, the <a4_0><b9_0>two<b9_0/><a4_0/> additional districts were added for, and the positions filled during, the August 2011 elections.
